ratings.comment: Well, it is very complicated to determine whether it is a good or bad class. It is very true that he is a responsible lecturer. He is super nice and caring. His lecture is clear. However he does make the final extremely challenging. It felt like he intentionally make the exam hard so that everyone fails this class. The reviews are very misguiding.

Erik is the GOAT! He will be one of the best professors you have. He's caring, funny, empathetic, fair and goes above and beyond for his students and cares about their success.  The worst thing about Erik is that when I didn't do well, I felt like I had nobody to blame but myself because he seriously seemed to be doing everything he could lol

Hands down the best professor you will ever have in college, TAKE HIS CLASSES IF YOU CAN, very knowledgeable and knows how to get you to understand, exams are very fair with nothing unexpected, he is great

If you're in a different university reading this, take his course. TAKE IT. You will not regret it. Such a fun professor makes everything so much fun. I wish I could take more courses with him! He really makes the course very interesting and loves teaching. He is very accessible and loves helping out!!!

Erik is the ever best professor I have met during my whole life. He always strives to explain the concept intuitively and experimentally, so we can enjoy the beauty of probability. Erik's lecture is super amazing and logically connected. He is very nice and accessible outside class, and the office hours are plenty and funny. Take his courses!!!!!

If every math professor was like Erik Bates, Wisconsin would have one of the best math departments in the nation. I went into every exam confident and never encountered any material that wasn't covered in section. HW is on par with other math courses. Bates cares about his students success. Will enroll in any of his future classes in a heartbeat.

Take any class that Erik is teaching. Just to give an idea of the type of professor he is, he started recording the in-person lectures with his iPad when I had to go into quarantine and continued for the rest of the semester. He is the best professor I've had at UW Madison and I would strongly recommend him to anyone interested in probability .

He is the best math professor I have ever had! Super nice person, explains the concepts very clearly, and is really willing to help the students to learn the material. His course notes were very helpful.

The course is very hard, but Erik made it as easy as possible. Lectures are always clear and easy to understand. Long and helpful office hours. He always helps students build intuition about mathematical topics and do sanity checks (unlike most Math professors who just talk about theory). In short, he is one of the best Math professors.

If you're reading this: TAKE WHATEVER COURSE DR. BATES IS TEACHING. Seriously, I can't fit how awesome he is into the character limit. His homework and exams can be tough, but he's *very* fair and empathetic. He goes out of his way to make lectures interesting and useful. He explains everything extremely clearly. I wish he could teach every course.

The course itself is very challenging, but Erik made everything very clear and easy to understand. He is the best and reasoning professor I have met so far. He actually cares about his students, wants us not only to understand the concepts but also how to use them in the real life. Highly recommend to take his course!!!!

If you want to deepen your understanding of probability with a talented professor who really wants you to understand probability, Erik is your best choice. Honestly, I don't care what grade I'm going to get in the end, that being his student has gained me lots of useful knowledge is more than enough. Trust me: professors like him are very rare.
